alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet; Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued October 11 at 1:23PM MDT until October 12 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO MIDNIGHT MDT TONIGHT... ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 3 PM MDT THURSDAY... ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM TO 8 PM MDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...A Wind Advisory for this evening with west winds increasing to 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. At midnight the advisory is upgraded to a High Wind Warning with west winds increasing to 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 60 mph. Tomorrow afternoon winds slacken a bit with a downgrade back to a Wind Advisory with west winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. * WHERE...Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet and East Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet. * WHEN...Wind Advisory begins at 9 PM this evening and continues to midnight MDT tonight. High Wind Warning begins at midnight tonight and continues through 3 PM MDT Thursday. Wind Advisory takes over at 3 PM and ends at 8 PM MDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are expected. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strongest winds are expected overnight through mid morning Thursday morning with strong gusts and brief lulls.
info.instruction: People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around trees and branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Use caution if you must drive.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet; Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet
